newsitem.title: SPAIN: Catalans Spanish budget amendments still pending.
newsitem.headline: Catalans Spanish budget amendments still pending.

text.p: The Spanish government's key Catalan allies said on Thursday that there were still a few amendments pending on the 1997 budget, which is crucial to Spain's aspirations to join Europe's single currency launch.
"There are still a few amendments pending. The committees are at work," a CiU's spokeswoman told Reuter.

She confirmed that Catalan Convergence and Union (CiU) recently withdrew some of its previous amendments in exchange for a new program of extra-budgetary investments which should bring in around 14 billion pesetas of additional investments.

The government is assured of passing the budget draft through the legislature with its own votes plus those of its regional allies in Catalonia, the Basque country and the Canary Islands. The final vote is scheduled for November 22.
The increased investment monies are funded in part by proceeds from the next years' privatization.
The rest will be drawn from private capital, which is expected to be invested in new companies which will build new roads in the region.
The 1997 budget also includes another three billion pesetas to finance direct public investments in the region.
